conclusion: Analyze the thermodynamic process using the first law of thermodynamics to find the heat absorbed.
Graph with volume V on vertical axis and temperature T on horizontal axis; process AB is vertical, indicating constant pressure; work done is 10 J.
Process AB is isobaric (constant pressure) as indicated by the vertical line segment.
Work done by the gas is 10 J; for isobaric process, work is W = p × ΔV.
Change in volume ΔV is the difference between volumes at states A and B, V_B - V_A.
First law of thermodynamics: ΔU = Q - W, where ΔU is change in internal energy, Q is heat absorbed, W is work done.
For an ideal gas, internal energy U is a function of temperature only; since T_A = T_B, ΔU = 0.
Equation becomes 0 = Q - 10; solving gives Q = 10 J.
